665381053.name: The best of the old west
665381053.author: a TripAdvisor user
665381053.reviewBody: Hello I visited the old one a few years ago and I really liked it a lot in December and it is a totally pleasant environment the people of this mini town is very passive, very tender, welcoming the truth that I loved going that day they made a work of teaotro very beautiful the girls are beautiful very beautiful and kind men are also handsome even the Indians, the food is delicious has several restaurants bars and places where you can buy some memory or very nice rapa deverdad that I loved being in the old west.

642685123.name: Bus was HORRIBLE
642685123.author: a TripAdvisor user
642685123.reviewBody: The bus driver cursed us out because we left the bus. We left the bus because we were told it was free when it was not. It costs $40 pesos and we were too many people to pay so we told the driver thank you but this is too much money and we\u2019ll go there ourselves. Then he started calling and telling us these horrible things. Finally, he started cursing us out.

576802557.name: Excellent place to visit and feel the vibe of the Old West
576802557.author: a TripAdvisor user
576802557.reviewBody:
It's worth the 15 minute drive from Durango to get to know this old west town.
They say they filmed old movies here, and I believe it's up to that.

Amazing picture opportunities, cheap entrance ticket, amenities and more.

558456731.name: At times a bit slow ... The show
558456731.author: a TripAdvisor user
558456731.reviewBody: A 15 minute drive fron downtown , not expensive to get in, nice r\u00e9plicas of the old western movies, has restaurants, restroom, drinks and the show

198588079.name: I\'m Glad I Went
198588079.author: a TripAdvisor user
198588079.reviewBody: My father loved westerns and would have loved this place.  Or else he would have been disappointed that Hollywood can make a fake small set look so real.  At the time I was thought it looked like a cheap amusement park.  The wind was blowing.  The dust was swirling.  The food and drinks were dusty and windblown.  But after getting home and looking at my photos I realized that the place does look better when filmed.  Now I want to go back and watch the old westerns and try to spot the buildings.  The show was simple, but fun and I think this place is worth a visit.

185704426.name: DON\'T MISS THIS ONE ON "SHOW DAY"!
185704426.author: a TripAdvisor user
185704426.reviewBody: Wow! Can first impressions be decieving?  The answer is an unqualified YES!  When we first pulled up to the entrance to the "Viejo Oeste" Theme park (15 minuets north of Durango City, Durango Mx...) I thought to myself: "Here\'s a tourist trap if I ever saw one"....I was wrong.  We had fortuantely stumbled upon this attraction at the very moment the occasional "show" was scheduled to begin.   What a wonderful time we had!  The show is typical of many of the old west theme parks one may encounter but the quality of the actors and the way they involve the audience in the show places this park a notch above the competition.   It is, of course, a big assist if one can speak or understand Spanish, which fortunately I do, but nonetheless, I strongly recommend this attraction to any and all who find themselves in the area.   Check local listings for "Show times" and if you happen to be there when no show is scheduled take a bit of time anyway to tour the town and enjoy the very engaging atmosphere.  Of course, horse back rides are available and the cantina serves the real stuff, but it is the friendly and talented staff of employees and actors that make this attraction worth every penny.   Speaking of "pennies", the entrance fee is phenomenally low.  Only 20 pesos (less than two US dollars)   Check it out!

155891357.name: The Old West
155891357.author: a TripAdvisor user
155891357.reviewBody: There have been over 150 feature films made in the State of Durango and this village is the movie set for many of them. You can rent a horse, take a buggy ride, dress up in period costumes for pictures, have a drink or something to eat in the restaurants and watch an old wild west shootout on the main street. A very enjoyable afternoon was spent here.

639023103.name: Puente de Ojuela visit
639023103.author: a TripAdvisor user
639023103.reviewBody: A little hard to find off the beaten path but am always interested in finding old mines and such. Interesting bridge to explore. The heat in the summer is something to avoid in midday. Take plenty of water and bring your camera. Off the main highway about 10 miles.

632836128.name: Opinion of PUENTE DE OJUELA
632836128.author: a TripAdvisor user
632836128.reviewBody:
Puentre de ojuela is a suspension bridge which is visited by many people from united states and Mexico. This suspension bridge is located in Durango state, near a little town called minipi.
Some opinions  that we can find  in tripadvisor are:"location are that is beautiful, the most impresionant places of the state."
When I went to  puente de Ojuela I was so excited, so I really enjoy the trip and the visit. 
I consider the puente de ojuela is one of the most impresionant places to visit in durango state, because you have amazing views of the desert and you can feel something incredible when you look down, and watch how you deep is the place, so I really recommend visit this place if you visit the beautiful state of Durango

558450755.name: S\u00faper.... But a few hours from Durango city
558450755.author: a TripAdvisor user
558450755.reviewBody: A great historic area to go.... The bridge is made of wood, by the same artpquitec who build the biridge of san Francisco , it conecta the land to the mine

435161746.name: The best of trip from Mazatlan
435161746.author: a TripAdvisor user
435161746.reviewBody: Out of about 50 bridges and 70 tunnels on the way from Mazatlan to Durango this is one of the most fascinating proof of Mexican road, bridges and tunnels expertice. Sometimes scary byt always fascinating.

289628487.name: Terrific experience in the Desert, Old Mine
289628487.author: a TripAdvisor user
289628487.reviewBody:
Located en route to Mapimi Durango, there is a small cabin where you pay your entry fee.
Once you reach the stone road, the experience begins. The mining town is located up and in the middle of a mountanous ridge, so riding the steep store road is a great sighseeing experience.
Once you reach, to the abandoned ghost mining town, everything is built in stone. There's a small old-traditional coffee house or "fonda" where you can eat freshly made corn or flour "gorditas" with lots of fillings to choose from. 

There is a tour to the mine with an expert guide, this will have an additional fee per person, but its worth because you get into mining gear, including real, old mine-lights.

To get there you need to walk through a very long wooden suspension bridge, which I learned it was the prototype to San Francisco's Golden Gate.

You can also ride one of the 4 or 5 zip lines, each with different lengths and heights.
So there's plenty to do while in this abandoned ghost mining town.

252925777.name: Cross that bridge in the air
252925777.author: a TripAdvisor user
252925777.reviewBody:
This bridge is unbelievable. "The Ojuela Bridge or the Mapimi Bridge (Puente de Ojuela, Spanish name) is a suspension bridge located in Mapimí, in the Mexican state of Durango, at the site of the Ojuela Mine. The Ojuela Bridge was built by the firm of John A. Roebling Sons Company, New York. Completed in 1898 the bridge was restored as a tourist attraction in 1991. It has a main span of 314 meters (1,030 feet). Currently this bridge is only used for pedestrians." Foros Torreon.

Mapimi is approximately 1 hour away from Torreon. I suggest you take a taxi from Mapimi to get to the bridge. The road from Mapimi to the bridge can be a bit hairy at times. The bridge is 100 meters above the bottom of the canyon. There is a tirolesa that goes from one side to the other, about 25 meters above the bridge. For those of you who like the tirolesa, this is a good one. 
The bridge connects the mine to the city of Ojuelo. This is where workers lived, ate, purchased things etc. Ruins are still there and show a comfortable city. The purpose of the bridge was to transport ore from the mine to the city of Ojuelo.

A very nice site to visit.

176826347.name: Unforgettable sight and experience
176826347.author: a TripAdvisor user
176826347.reviewBody: My trip to Ojuela brigde and Mapimi was one of the most memorable trips in Mexico.  It wasn\'t easy to get there independently but it was well worth it.  Hotels are hard to find in Mapimi.  You have to ask people around because there aren\'t any hotel signs and hardly any tourists stay in Mapimi.  But if you do have time, stay in Mapimi to get to know this very historical town and the friendliest locals you will ever know in your life.  I ended up staying with a local family and we all went to the Ojuela bridge with a group of friends.  We walked up from the car park to maximize our experience and to enjoy the scenery.  It took us just over an hour.  Finally we got to the bridge and it was totally impressive.  Walking across the bridge wasn\'t as scary as it seemed.  We entered the ex gold mine on the other side of the bridge which was totally complete and amazing.  We exit the mine at the other end climbing some steps and the scenery from up there was stunning.  We could see the Ojuela bridge from up there.  Thank you everyone in Mapimi for such an unforgettable experience during my 2 day stay there.

153851856.name: The Puente de Ojuela is in Torreon, not Durango!
153851856.author: a TripAdvisor user
153851856.reviewBody: I was looking forward to seeing this bridge that Tripadvisor has located near Durango. It is actually close to Torreon, a good 150 miles from the city of Durango.

135587834.name: Impresive!
135587834.author: a TripAdvisor user
135587834.reviewBody: A ghost town with a lot of history, it is amazing the history here and the tallest/longest walking suspension bridge maybe in the world.\nThe Tours inside the mine are amazing. a must see if you are in the area...\n

447188110.name: Pretty and enjoyable, beautifully lighted up for the season
447188110.author: a TripAdvisor user
447188110.reviewBody:
Very pretty natural resource in the middle of the city.
Beautifully adorned for the Christmas season with thousands of lights, a digital singing Christmas tree in the middle of the lake that changes images to Christmas music. Santa's Train gives you a ride around the park for 20 pesos, pretty enjoyable. 
The have a Human sized nativity with animals and all!
And of course you can find any kind of Mexican food around the park!

369040517.name: Best place to hang out in a park setting
369040517.author: a TripAdvisor user
369040517.reviewBody: I\'ve visited this place since I was a child! Great memories! Fresh juices along with fresh air and a perfect place to walk around with family and friends!

337284135.name: A breath of fresh air
337284135.author: a TripAdvisor user
337284135.reviewBody: This place was amazing, hundreds of eucalyptus trees your lungs feel cleansed after walking around there, lots of great little attractions, they had a huge birth scene of Jesus, they have areas with workout machines, a lot of wading pools and an olympic pool (which are seasonal), a lot of walking, running and biking trails, lots of food vendors it was great.

289339374.name: Nice outing
289339374.author: a TripAdvisor user
289339374.reviewBody: I used to take my daughter here when I lived in Durango. This is the best park there. You can feed the ducks, walk around, there are swings, slides and monkey bars for the kids and there is a small train, I mean small, with cars attached to take the children and adults for a ride around the pond.\nLot\'s of people do there running here. It\'s safe during daylight hours.

262668981.name: Relax in Durango
262668981.author: a TripAdvisor user
262668981.reviewBody: This park is absolutely beautiful!  We went there for a couple of hours on our way out of town.  It is a place where you can relax in the midst of the BIG CITY.  There are gardens to see, a lake, a train to ride around the park, a reproduction of the Baluarte Bridge, swimming pool, amusements, picnic areas, even a row of reproductions of famous sites around the world:  Eiffel Tower, Statue of Liberty, Taj Mahal, for example.  We will definitely go to Parque Guadiana the next time we are in Durango.  There is another park next to Guadiana called Sahuato which has a zoo in it.  So, if you have kids, that would be a good place to take them.

227320888.name: One of the best city parks in Mexico
227320888.author: a TripAdvisor user
227320888.reviewBody: We went on Sunday, which is family day in Mexico (every Sunday). There was activity everywhere. If you like to walk or jog, it\'s the perfect place to do it.

219860352.name: City Park
219860352.author: a TripAdvisor user
219860352.reviewBody: This is the city\'s main park and I had not visited this area of the city.  I was amazed with its cleanliness, its flowers and a clock imbedded in a garden made out of flowers and grass.  It was about 9pm and there were no police nor any negative things to speak of.  Very nice.

126244287.name: relaxing
126244287.author: a TripAdvisor user
126244287.reviewBody: .. nice place to go and relax, ride the train around the park its fun, lots of vendors with food and fun games.

115733829.name: Great place!
115733829.author: a TripAdvisor user
115733829.reviewBody: I actually grew up in Durango,so I remember this park,It still looks as good as I remember it!.Gotta love that little train!

923853.name: The Most Beautiful Park in the World
923853.author: a TripAdvisor user
923853.reviewBody: I was born in Durango, so I went there very often.  The last time that I went was this summer.  There is a cute little train that goes through the whole park.  El Parque Guadiana is HUGE!  There are little miniature parks everywhere.  There are also food stands everywhere.  If you are an active person, you are able to hike or jog around.  On festive days, they have festivals and they also have a little fair.  El Parque Guadiana is also about 2 blocks away from a free zoo.  This park has been by far the best park that I have ever been to.

651850124.name: Good place
651850124.author: a TripAdvisor user
651850124.reviewBody: Many bars and restaurants, occasional events on the corridor at the weekends. Family atmosphere and excellent location.

631279720.name: A must-good-vibe stroll
631279720.author: a TripAdvisor user
631279720.reviewBody: A must-walk in evenings and weekends to enjoy the popular and social local life. You can visit other nearby places such as the Cathedral, fountains, the main square, some theatres, sculptures of film actors (Dolores del R\u00edo), and obviously, taste different snacks and food. I think that every town council contributes to improve this colonial walk because there are several small shows on Sundays: break dancing, living statues, clowns, and singers.

591153479.name: Colonial street in Durango
591153479.author: a TripAdvisor user
591153479.reviewBody: Durango is very different than where I lived in Puerto Vallarta and that\'s a positive thing.  El Centro at night (during my visit) was quiet and secure.  I\'m sure that it can hope during the Festivals, but it was just a lovely quiet time.

568965338.name: Great place to stroll along in the evening
568965338.author: a TripAdvisor user
568965338.reviewBody: Lovely to just stroll along, it us quite long & the whole street is worth a visit. Lots of caf\u00e9s & restaurants, in the evening great live music, find a bench & enjoy.

564427162.name: another   of  the    very   awesome  old  streets
564427162.author: a TripAdvisor user
564427162.reviewBody: this    town  is   well  worth  the  drive  no  matter   how  far  away  you  are    an  old  spanish   mining  town  with  so  much  history   everything  is   3-5  hundred  years  old  clean   safe  and    lots  to  see   and  do

558450118.name: Just hace to walk
558450118.author: a TripAdvisor user
558450118.reviewBody: Is ni e to go it has a few blocks to walk it has historic buildings, restaurant , caf\u00e9s, shops, great area

550142541.name: Good to enjoy a stroll.
550142541.author: a TripAdvisor user
550142541.reviewBody: An area for pedestrians to take a stroll along the many shops and restaurants. Great opportunity for pictures with the Cathedral as a backdrop.

493845261.name: A must do!
493845261.author: a TripAdvisor user
493845261.reviewBody: Definitely a must do if in Durango. The absence of vehicular traffic is such a treat. Lots of shops, markets, bars and restaurants to visit. Always something going on here; music, markets, culture etc. Had a great visit!

478045081.name: A great traffic free street
478045081.author: a TripAdvisor user
478045081.reviewBody: Had lots of fun walking up and down the street. Our hotel opened right up onto the blvd. Felt a little european. Lots of bars, restaurants and shops. People of all ages enjoying the street. Many interesting side streets off the main avenue.

477547153.name: Check it out the street is happening
477547153.author: a TripAdvisor user
477547153.reviewBody: There\'s less to see on the street it\'s worth driving up and down and checking out what it has to offer

471500154.name: Should be emulated. Wonderful.
471500154.author: a TripAdvisor user
471500154.reviewBody: Wonderful to stroll, window shop, chat and people watch. We enjoyed seeing all the businesses along the Calle.

470278241.name: A nice avenue to stroll and see Mexicans having their day
470278241.author: a TripAdvisor user
470278241.reviewBody: This is a car-free road for shopping.  It starts at a basilica and runs for several blocks.  We didn\'t find any shops to interest us, they are your everyday shops for everyday people.  That\'s what we enjoyed - seeing how people live their lives in another place.\n\nThere is a gelato shop that was very good.

462002753.name: Every town needs a street like this
462002753.author: a TripAdvisor user
462002753.reviewBody: Every town needs a street like this, with restaurants and shops all in walking distance.  Lots of good restaurants.  From centro plaza north for about five or six blocks all blocked off from traffic, except for cross traffic.

447188892.name: you HAVE TO walk this Street
447188892.author: a TripAdvisor user
447188892.reviewBody: If You visit Durango don\'t leave with out walking al the way through this picturesque street\nYou will find art crafts, typical Durango Mexican candy, beautiful historic buildings and a lot of cute cozy coffee shops along its way!

411221210.name: You must come to this place
411221210.author: a TripAdvisor user
411221210.reviewBody: Calle Constitucion is a great street with blocked off trafic and I highly recommend to sit outside and enjoy the passing by people and the nice weather.

402531426.name: lots of bars and restaurants
402531426.author: a TripAdvisor user
402531426.reviewBody: it is absolutely a nice street especially in the evening.\nLots of bars and restaurants for everybody\u2019s taste

389406472.name: Nothing aesome
389406472.author: a TripAdvisor user
389406472.reviewBody: Just a closed street with to Many coffee shops , nithing that would draw me back there gain.  the city needs to do somthing Better

379227472.name: Nice place for a scenic walk
379227472.author: a TripAdvisor user
379227472.reviewBody: Calle Constituci\u00f3n is a wonderful street to enjoy a nice scenic walk. The street has a good variety of shops and restaurants. You can also find a trolley that will give you a tour thru the historic center of Durango.

358326621.name: Quaint
358326621.author: a TripAdvisor user
358326621.reviewBody: It was quaint, peaceful. Terrible cafes and coffee, but the shopping was ok. The people are friendly.

356173606.name: Stroll n shop
356173606.author: a TripAdvisor user
356173606.reviewBody: Stroll and shop or grab a bite to eat, l guess.  Best part is that is is traffic free and a part of the fabulous colonial city which is magical at night

337280693.name: Great pedestrian street
337280693.author: a TripAdvisor user
337280693.reviewBody: This was great lots of really good restaurants, and clubs, and stores, it felt pretty safe too. They had  this restaurant with traditional cuisine, that was amazing, and extremely affordable.

327257877.name: Beautiful downtown street
327257877.author: a TripAdvisor user
327257877.reviewBody: Very nice place to visit. Beautiful rustic colonial architecture. Good restaurants, Old churches, shops, and Small parks.

321745662.name: Well restored downtown
321745662.author: a TripAdvisor user
321745662.reviewBody: Very nicely illuminated at night. All the typical electric cables have been eliminated and put underground, so the look and feel of the street is very nice.

295838433.name: it\'s ok
295838433.author: a TripAdvisor user
295838433.reviewBody: I have walked down this street many, many times, before and after they changed it.\nI still believe there are many better places to see in Durango than this. Parque Guadiana, John Wayne\'s old ranch north of the city, the cathedral, 20 de Noviembre, the market.

262666916.name: Pleasant stroll
262666916.author: a TripAdvisor user
262666916.reviewBody: We enjoyed walking this street that is blocked off for traffic.  One part has hotels and restaurants and another part has an area dedicated to the movie industry in Durango.  There are statues of movie stars, stars on the walkway with stars\' names on them.  We walked along this street 3 or 4 times.  It is just so pleasant.

255036274.name: Great walking street
255036274.author: a TripAdvisor user
255036274.reviewBody: Perfect walking street. I stayed at a hotel on the same street. What I noticed right away was how clean everything was. No trash, gum on the sidewalk,etc. If you have traveled Mexico at all you realize most cities here don\'t understand that concept. This street should have had nicer restaurants and shops.

248120961.name: Ok, not amazing
248120961.author: a TripAdvisor user
248120961.reviewBody:
Just like just about every large city, there is a main strip of stores to cater to the tourists visiting the area. This is that main drag. These kinds of stores can be found almost anywhere outside of Mexico and really isnt interesting at all. 

However, this street does connect to a lot of interesting museums, the cathedral, plazas, and other interesting cultural and historical places, so that is a plus side.

If you really want to go shopping in Mexico, find one of the big enclosed malls where you can find flowers, food, leather goods, household goods, pottery, and a huge variety of cheap and interesting knickknacks and souvenirs that will remind you much more of being in Mexico and Durango than anything you can find on Calle Constutucion.

213080254.name: Enjoyable walk
213080254.author: a TripAdvisor user
213080254.reviewBody: My wife and I enjoyed walking along this pedestrian street.  There are all sorts of store, restaurants, benches, and people.  This is an area that people gather in in the late afternoon and evenings.  I have seen assorted type of entertainment there in the evenings but mostly on the weekends.  There is a beautiful church to visit there as well.  On little restaurant I really enjoyed when sampling foods of Durango was called Las Ra\u00edces.  We ate in the back patio and the decorations wer very enjoyable for us.  Finish off your walk with some great icecream at the south end of the street.  What a great walk.

211145519.name: BEAUTIFUL STREETS
211145519.author: a TripAdvisor user
211145519.reviewBody: I sooo loved walking down this street. So many shops, restaurants. Restaurants, shops, bars. Churros Dolores is a great shop that I recommend. You can get hot chocalate, to go along with a delicious freshly Churro. So many historic buildings. Plenty of places to sit during the summer time. Once you walk down the whole street, which doesnt take a long time , you can go see the rest of downtown. Cathedral, Francisco Villa Museum. etc, etc.

198585860.name: Great place to spend time
198585860.author: a TripAdvisor user
198585860.reviewBody: We were happy to stumble upon this street.  It\'s a great place to hang out, people watch, and enjoy weekend entertainment.  We were surprised at the limited dining options, but maybe more will come soon.

194796239.name: Simply Beautiful
194796239.author: a TripAdvisor user
194796239.reviewBody: We really enjoyed this area of Durango.  There are lots of historic buildings, shops and restaurants in this area.  It is very nice just to walk around and see everything.  We also noticed that it is a very peaceful place.  We would really love to go back and spend more time here.

189937690.name: Wonderful surprise
189937690.author: a TripAdvisor user
189937690.reviewBody: Our little hotel was on the Calle Constitucion and the night we were there was the celebration of the King so entertainment started about 5:00 and ended late.  Families strolling from one end of the pedestrian street to the other.  We sat for hours listening to classically trained singers engaging the crowd with Mexican music and one ended his program with "My Way" in Spanish.  The Christmas lights and decorations were wonderful and the friendliness of the people has made us plan a second trip.

155244663.name: Great Street
155244663.author: a TripAdvisor user
155244663.reviewBody: There is a section of this street starting from Plaza des Armas that runs for about 7 blocks that does not have any vehicular traffic except for the cross streets. We were there on Thursday, Friday and Saturday. During the day there are loads of restaurants, shops and coffee/beverage houses and at night it lights up with all kinds of entertainment and people strolling. We were fortunate to see a competition of singers from 10 different universities in Mexico. The singing groups are called \'Tunas\' which is a tradition started in Europe in the 1300\'s and has also found a home in Mexico. The music was great...Spanish folk songs...and even though we did not understand the words it was a wonderful show.

146460649.name: Historic city center
146460649.author: a TripAdvisor user
146460649.reviewBody: This pedestrian street is where all the action is, especially when it gets dark. Most of all the restaurants, bars, and stores are located here. We walked around to the other side streets only to find a few places of interest or just being deserted.

126244209.name: awesome!
126244209.author: a TripAdvisor user
126244209.reviewBody: very mordern and fun! must visit Sat night that when its the best!

655544711.name: Guided tour - historical and educational
655544711.author: a TripAdvisor user
655544711.reviewBody: We had a wonderful tour guide.  He had excellent knowledge of all the rock names and history.  The underground tunnel is part of many tunnels throughout the city but only this one is open to the public.  It is a great way to learn about Durango\u2019s history. Mining is a fundamental trade in Durango and it has shaped its culture and people.

653597593.name: Unique
653597593.author: a TripAdvisor user
653597593.reviewBody: Very cool tunnel museum.   You enter in one spot and exit a few blocks away.  Especially nice to get out of the hot sun for a bit.

651133108.name: Very cool. Tour
651133108.author: a TripAdvisor user
651133108.reviewBody: This is a great your for the whole family. Old.  Mine almost in the city was the center of the city at one time a mine is over 300 years old well worth the tour

646138543.name: Out for an adventure in Durango
646138543.author: a TripAdvisor user
646138543.reviewBody: This was an exciting experience. Definitely worth the money. Learned a lot. I totally recommend to do the guided tour.

588182424.name: Very interesting experience!
588182424.author: a TripAdvisor user
588182424.reviewBody: Took a self-guided tour. We read the English translations, and were able to understand some of the Spanish as well. We have 2 geologists in our family, both working in mining, so we were familiar with some of what we saw. Beautiful crystals, and well-displayed. Enjoyed the history of mining in and around Durango.

559814055.name: History of the mining in Durango
559814055.author: a TripAdvisor user
559814055.reviewBody: A good museum if you are interested in mining and history. It\u00b4s nice to get a bit a feeling about how the miners worked in the past!

509527678.name: Good to check out...
509527678.author: a TripAdvisor user
509527678.reviewBody: This museum was entertaining, but it would\'ve been much more interesting if there were English translations for ALL of the displays. There are some English language displays. To be able to fully understand it all is vital to the enjoyment of this important historical industry in Durango. Unfortunately, our Spanish is not at the level to understand the displays and the English speaking guide was not available when we went. I love how you enter in one location, travel through the "mine" underground and exit in a totally different place! The tunnel was a nice respite from the summer heat, likely one of the reasons it was very crowded.

478043734.name: Underground and fun.
478043734.author: a TripAdvisor user
478043734.reviewBody: A great way to spend an hour or two. Definitly take a guide. The fellow we had was very knowledgeable about mining in Durango. We would have struggled without him. Elevator to get up and down and an easy, smooth walk through the tunnel.

477546410.name: Felt more like a museum
477546410.author: a TripAdvisor user
477546410.reviewBody: I thought it would get more of an authentic feel of the tunnels but it felt more like a museum. You can go with the tour guide which takes 30 minutes or if you want to walk on your own it\'s a little bit faster. There\'s great food on either entrance of the tunnel. We accessed here through the plaza de armas where there are a bunch of glass doors and you can see stairs going down.

468769010.name: Highly recommended
468769010.author: a TripAdvisor user
468769010.reviewBody: you take elevator 1 floor down in the main plaza and walk thru the tunnel museum 2 blocks underground... amazing... and very inexpensive! it is worth visiting

430077708.name: Nice tour
430077708.author: a TripAdvisor user
430077708.reviewBody: I liked the tour reflects the minning situation in the old times in durango, it is interesting to know about this part of durango and how this happen, nice

341088216.name: Fake tunnel
341088216.author: a TripAdvisor user
341088216.reviewBody: This is actually a plastic tunnel in the heart of Durango.  Tour gives some information about the mining history of Durango and Mexico but nothing very current and nothing about the actual location.  English speaking guide spoke heavily accented English very softly.  Only one Person in our group could hear him.

318962281.name: Interesting city tour right under the main streets in downtown Durango
318962281.author: a TripAdvisor user
318962281.reviewBody: It is anly two to mthree blocks long, under the streets of downtown Durango, interesting but I thought it was an original mine,but  not so it\u00b4s man made side attraction.

284377710.name: Very interesting tour
284377710.author: a TripAdvisor user
284377710.reviewBody: We found this museum almost by accident and are happy that we did. The tour guide was very interesting and well-informed. Thoroughly enjoyed our time in the \'mine\'.

281619373.name: Nice
281619373.author: a TripAdvisor user
281619373.reviewBody: When I went they did not have a tour in English and I don\'t speak Spanish.  But it was a nice little break and not to expensive.  Interesting history...  some of the signs are in English and that helped.

262961745.name: More than I expected.....45 minutes well spent
262961745.author: a TripAdvisor user
262961745.reviewBody: Went on self guided tour on a whim. Most of the exhibits in Spanish...about every third exhibit has an english description. Very interesting history of mining in the state of Durango. Long history of mineral extraction for Spain. A very easy tour......

262776969.name: Learning experience
262776969.author: a TripAdvisor user
262776969.reviewBody: We walked through the Silver Mine Museum stopping to read all the  information, look at all the photos, saw all displays.  Upon entering we were given a hard hat and an orange vest to wear.  All the way through we could hear the clinking of picks on the ore.  There are large maps with guides to show how the mining industry expanded in the Durango region.  We noticed that many of the descriptions were in English and well as Spanish, so for those who aren\'t fluent in Spanish it is a help.  The museum is underground and wiggles around the center of the city for about 4 blocks.  Don\'t miss it!

248123736.name: Cool exhibits but not amazing
248123736.author: a TripAdvisor user
248123736.reviewBody: This museum takes you underground in a semi-authentic looking mining tunnel. There are quite a few exhibits regarding the history of mining in the state of Durango, but unless you are especially interested in mining it probably won\'t wow you though. Cant go wrong for 20 pesos though! Your ticket to the museum will act as a half-off coupon for the teleferico cable car too.\n\nIf you think any of the souvenirs at the entrance to the museum are cool, grab them because its a one-way trip to about 2 blocks away from the start!

239035747.name: Great little museum
239035747.author: a TripAdvisor user
239035747.reviewBody: Great little museum, follows an original underground mine passage.   The guides do not speak English but there is information plaques and they are in both Spanish and English.  Plenty of original mining tools, artefacts, paints a very good picture of how mining was done in the ole west.

210925621.name: Don\'t miss it
210925621.author: a TripAdvisor user
210925621.reviewBody: Very interesting. I suggest you get a guided tour. The tour lasts about an hour. Its not as crammed as I thought it would have been. Very well lit.

198122769.name: Rather Dark Even for a Mine
198122769.author: a TripAdvisor user
198122769.reviewBody: Lovely samples of the ores from which the lead, zinc, copper and iron were gleaned.  Quite an experience for those not acquainted with mines.   Poorly lit where the explanations were.   Rather cool to be in a "mine" in the midst of the city!

186533327.name: Educational
186533327.author: a TripAdvisor user
186533327.reviewBody: They give you a vest and a hard hat, which makes the experience very real. Inexpensive and very Educational tour and a must do while in Durango. Ride the "Teleferico" first they give you a coupon for a discount entrance to Museo Tunel De Mineria. Its very shorta small tour but well worth the money you will pay about $3 USD

157267157.name: mining
157267157.author: a TripAdvisor user
157267157.reviewBody: It was kind of a disappointment. 1: walls were made / covered with paper machie material, made to look like rock. 2:Guide\'s, english was spotty. But was nice place to get out of the sun....

155002190.name: Underground in Durango
155002190.author: a TripAdvisor user
155002190.reviewBody: The entrance to this mining museum is right in the main plaza. It is a tunnel about 280 metres long containing artifacts and information about the development of the mining industry in the Durango area. Our guide was very good and was able to answer most of our questions. The tunnel itself was dimly lit, likely for effect. A good way to spend an hour.

153896895.name: Interesting displays of mining
153896895.author: a TripAdvisor user
153896895.reviewBody: The tunnel is quite long and pretty dark, many displays on minerals and mining, some on the history of this part of Mexico. Some displays had english descriptions but the translations made for tough reading. Very reasonably priced.

148293233.name: Under the plaza
148293233.author: a TripAdvisor user
148293233.reviewBody: Most people will walk by the entrance without knowing that there is a mining museum right below them. It is located right in the old city\'s main plaza, it will take you less than an hour to visit the whole tunnel. The low priced entrance fee makes it a must visit location.

581079776.name: Beautiful...
581079776.author: a TripAdvisor user
581079776.reviewBody: If you were ever to consider having a destination wedding this would be an unusual and fabulous place to have it...

647665986.name: Beautiful cathedral
647665986.author: a TripAdvisor user
647665986.reviewBody: very nicely done .  I learned it was one of 2 cathedrals in Mexico that still has an eagle on it.  Originally the had a crown, replaced by eagles and then crosses. Area very clean and well managed brand nes.

594608899.name: Cathedral Durango
594608899.author: a TripAdvisor user
594608899.reviewBody: Beautiful cathedral! Center of town and the bells ringing are beautiful with a great history! A must see while in Durango, Mexico

581079984.name: Wonderful...
581079984.author: a TripAdvisor user
581079984.reviewBody: I\'m not a religious person but the history associated with these old churches is amazing.  worth a visit.

568964719.name: Beautiful Building
568964719.author: a TripAdvisor user
568964719.reviewBody: As you will probably pass right by this building at somw point, it is definitely worth popping inside, lovely inside and out.

564425345.name: just   an  amazing   building   most  of  the    cathedrals   are    3-4  hundred   years  old
564425345.author: a TripAdvisor user
564425345.reviewBody: i  walked   by   the    cathedral   at  nite   first  it  was  all  lit  up   amazing  it  was   just  past   christmas    all  the  streets  were   lit  up  was  very   cool

558449526.name: Great \u00e1rea to go
558449526.author: a TripAdvisor user
558449526.reviewBody: The point to all, here you can start your tour, near all important areas of Durango city at the end of plaza de armas is the touristir troley

541033425.name: Instills a certain sense of awe....
541033425.author: a TripAdvisor user
541033425.reviewBody: Came during the Day of the Dead festivities and the Cathedral was quite busy and decorated . Many fine works of art and statuary. On a grander scale and well maintained. There are so many in Mexico that they all start to to look a bit alike but I think because of the charm of the area around it and the people\'s obvious pride in their city it made it stand out more than others. Cleanest Mexican city I have ever seen. No garbage or funky smells in old town at all.

506057163.name: nice cathedral
506057163.author: a TripAdvisor user
506057163.reviewBody: you can spend a few time in this place, is in front of main square downtown and there a several restaurants around.

493845014.name: A must see
493845014.author: a TripAdvisor user
493845014.reviewBody: The cathedral was breath taking. As I visited during the month of May, offerings and devotions were being offered to the Virgin Mary. The history and architecture that was preserved is definitely a site to see. So beautiful and humbling.

478044348.name: A very big church
478044348.author: a TripAdvisor user
478044348.reviewBody: If you have seen one big church, you have seen them all. As architecture it is massive. Lots of icons and lots of stained glass. As a social comment about the churches wealth vs. the struggling people not so impressive.

477545839.name: Worth seeing at night
477545839.author: a TripAdvisor user
477545839.reviewBody: It\'s a beautiful cathedral and it\'s nice to see at night. There are things to do at the plaza de armas which is nearby

467464811.name: Nice to see
467464811.author: a TripAdvisor user
467464811.reviewBody: Went on a city tour and this was one of the stops. I\'m not overly religious butvit was still nice to see.

464032544.name: Grand
464032544.author: a TripAdvisor user
464032544.reviewBody: A grand, sumptuously decorated cathedral. Well looked after, situated in the centre of Durango. Maybe not one to go out of your way for, but if you\'re in town it\'s worth sticking your head in.

462002156.name: Very Nice
462002156.author: a TripAdvisor user
462002156.reviewBody: Very Nice cathedral.  Has a nice plaza across the street with plenty of restaurants and shops around.  Worth a visit.

458290676.name: A sight to see !
458290676.author: a TripAdvisor user
458290676.reviewBody: Visited the amazing Cathedral and were blown away! The architecture is unbelievable, the colours and size is just a must see. Be sure to visit when in Centro. Across the street is the square with shoe shiners, vendors and people just wandering around. There is a walking street (no cars) near by with celebrity statues and a make shift hollywood walk of fame with stars. Do not miss this while in Durango.

457383114.name: Impressive Cathedral in the Centre of Durango
457383114.author: a TripAdvisor user
457383114.reviewBody: This beautiful cathedral located in the centre of Durango began to be constructed in 1695.  It is one of the more impressive Mexican cathedrals on the inside.  It is a must see attraction in the heart of the nice downtown area.

447188337.name: Must see
447188337.author: a TripAdvisor user
447188337.reviewBody: Beautiful original piece of architecture\nstill fully functional and very busy its a must see in Durango Dowtown

445112130.name: Another fabulous cathedral
445112130.author: a TripAdvisor user
445112130.reviewBody: We were not able to fully visit the cathedral as there was a service ongoing. However, our limited view did display a fine old cathedral as is found in many larger Mexican cities.

443833442.name: beautiful cathedral
443833442.author: a TripAdvisor user
443833442.reviewBody: its nice to walk around the park before going into the building. it is a beautiful building with a lot of detail in the entrances

411220064.name: A must when you come to Durango.
411220064.author: a TripAdvisor user
411220064.reviewBody: The cathedral is very nice and also the Zocalo.  You also must have a coffee or drink in Avenida Insurgentes.  Lovely street.  The best in Durando.

405806532.name: Beautiful!
405806532.author: a TripAdvisor user
405806532.reviewBody: Our visit to the Cathedral was both as tourist and as a wedding guest.  The antiquity was without question.  A definite stop while visiting Durango.

390468765.name: Lovely
390468765.author: a TripAdvisor user
390468765.reviewBody: Beautiful d\u00e9cor and interior.  Church and funeral were taking place during our visit.  Hope to return for a better view.

358326437.name: Nothing to get excited about
358326437.author: a TripAdvisor user
358326437.reviewBody: I\'m sure it\'s "special" for the folks who grew up here, but it\'s hardly inspiring. If you\'ve been to Europe, then this isn\'t going to impress you.

356163312.name: Still magical
356163312.author: a TripAdvisor user
356163312.reviewBody: Returning to Durango after 50 years, such a thrill.  The colonial city is as spectacular as ever, bringing back so many fond memories,,,,\ud83c\udfbcLa tierra  de los alacranes, El Parque Guadiana tienen mil recuerdos\ud83c\udfa4\u2764\ufe0f Viva M\u00e9xico\ud83c\udf8b

351700313.name: Nice but . . .
351700313.author: a TripAdvisor user
351700313.reviewBody: This cathedral is active and located near the main plaza in the Historical Zone.  Beautiful but similar to most cathedrals of the same age.

351426976.name: Beautiful!
351426976.author: a TripAdvisor user
351426976.reviewBody: A beautiful and wonderfully maintained cathedral. Recommend that anyone interested in colonial churches go see it, as this will give a very good sense of what major churches must have been like back in the day and what they could be like now, with little effort. The parish priest noted that the costs for keeping look this were not much more than before, the difference was a little lighting, a little paint, and keeping it all clean. Congratulations to the archdiocese and for creating an unexpectedly world-class attraction for Durango.

341087863.name: Nice
341087863.author: a TripAdvisor user
341087863.reviewBody: Okay if you are into churches.  A regular cathedral. Nothing special. Nice location in old town Durango.

337071674.name: Beautiful building
337071674.author: a TripAdvisor user
337071674.reviewBody: It is maybe one of the most well maintained cathedrals I\'ve seen in Mexico. It has a really nice architecture and since the city is really small it is easy to arrive. \n\nAs almost everything at Durango it has a legend of its own. It\'s said that there was once a nun waiting for her lost love... Now you can see her still waiting every night at one of the towers.

336229162.name: Cathedral
336229162.author: a TripAdvisor user
336229162.reviewBody: It was a nice experience, there is a coffee place place call cucurumbe a couple of blocks away. We ended up grabbing a cup of coffee and taking a walk to the cathedral, looking for the "monja", a town legend which is said to appears on one of the towers.

329252783.name: the cathedral
329252783.author: a TripAdvisor user
329252783.reviewBody: the cathedral is beautiful, the people very friendly wherever lots of food and very good everything is very central

323288051.name: Authentic Mexico
323288051.author: a TripAdvisor user
323288051.reviewBody: Durango isn\'t yet a tourist destination. But it should be. Great shopping, history, great food, mezcal. It\'s doable as a day trip from Mazatlan with the new road. But staying over night would be better. Don\'t miss the church on the hill accessed via a gondola. The cathedral and surrounding square is also worth visiting, as are the tunnels, and the Hollywood walk. The food, alcohol, and places to stay the night are cheap in price but not quality. We enjoyed our time here.

321747824.name: One of the main attractions in Durango
321747824.author: a TripAdvisor user
321747824.reviewBody: Must see in Durango. Try to go inside and look around. The main fa\u00e7ade is baroque-style and nicely maintained. One of the most important cathedrals in Mexico.

320570706.name: Pretty On OUtside
320570706.author: a TripAdvisor user
320570706.reviewBody: Did not go into the Cathedral. Took pictures from the outside. Pictures are of Abstract nature. The streets going to it is right in the hub of busy traffic. Lots of big buses and noise.

318535928.name: Very Nice and Historic
318535928.author: a TripAdvisor user
318535928.reviewBody: We were fortunate to be invited and attend a wedding in the cathedral. The cathedral is very old and has been well preserved. It was great to see the many individuals that were visiting. One note, the seating is fairly limited. There are two rows of benches with a center isle. If you\'re planning to attend a large service or wedding, arrive early for the best seating. \n\nOverall, great place and I would definitely recommend a visit.

289343834.name: Cathedral
289343834.author: a TripAdvisor user
289343834.reviewBody: This is an old cathedral in the heart of downtown Durango. The inside is awe inspiring and apparently there are tunnels that run below, but not open to the public. One of the better things to see in Durango.

263579963.name: Beautiful Outside
263579963.author: a TripAdvisor user
263579963.reviewBody: Very nice cathedral. Must see but a little worn looking inside. Not well kept for a great structure.\nPoorly maintained.

262962500.name: Started construction in 1695.......that is longer than I can remember
262962500.author: a TripAdvisor user
262962500.reviewBody: Quite a church...over 350 years of construction....it was next to our hotel Posada San Augustin so was an easy short tour. Most of the colonial cities, in Mexico, have the Church with Concha (park) configuration. Take a few minutes and check out these historical sites.

262666394.name: Cathedral visit
262666394.author: a TripAdvisor user
262666394.reviewBody: The Cathedral in Durango is a Basilica - it is huge!   Be sure to look at the choir stall in back of the main altar.  There are 33 wooden chairs carved between 1730-1740 with likenesses of apostles, church founders, angels.  They are quite spectacular.  You are not allowed into that area, however you will be able to photograph some of the chairs.

262658399.name: Durango, Mexico Tour with Mazatlan Van Tours
262658399.author: a TripAdvisor user
262658399.reviewBody: I was very pleased with our choice of choosing Mazatlan Van Tours for our trip to Durango. -When I found the web-page, I had some detailed questions, so I contacted Jay Anderson via e-mail and he answered all of them. The arrangements were then made easily. We chose the 2-day overnight tour because we wanted to allow enough time to see all that was available and not be hurried or miss anything. Durango is a very interesting city to visit, and the road there was amazing with all the tunnels and the beautiful Baluarte Bridge. Our tour guide/driver, Juan Jose Hernandez Chavira, was an excellent tour guide. He was personable, helpful, knowledgeable and translated for us what was said & shown to us by others. We enjoyed our tour and recommend it to everyone who wants to visit Durango, plus recommend this tour company for any other tours they offer.

257132222.name: Beautiful Durango
257132222.author: a TripAdvisor user
257132222.reviewBody: Tours excellent by Skippo in Mazatlan 044(669)993 77 07 beautiful Durango.  Stayed at Hotel Posta San Agustin in historical district easy walking to square

248868986.name: Splendid cathedral
248868986.author: a TripAdvisor user
248868986.reviewBody: The building is lovely. The \'cantera\' stone it is made of give it such a character. The \'plaza\' just in front of it filled with locals is quite enjoyable.

229249775.name: Lovely Cathedral in a beautiful Durango!
229249775.author: a TripAdvisor user
229249775.reviewBody: It is amazing and unique.  I love the palm trees around it.  I was not able to go inside but the outside is worth seeing and is a great city landmark.

198026872.name: Serene Beauty
198026872.author: a TripAdvisor user
198026872.reviewBody: Lovely exterior architectural elements, baroque style.  Wonderful location in the Centro.   Delightful ceiling paintings welcoming one to heaven...

194796550.name: Very Unique
194796550.author: a TripAdvisor user
194796550.reviewBody: Sadly this cathedral was not open, so we did not get to see the inside.  However the outside is very interesting and unique.  The bell towers are amazing. There is a bell in each opening of each bell tower. I would really enjoy going back when the church is open so that I could take a peak inside.  Be sure and visit the square that is across from this church.

126244186.name: very interesting
126244186.author: a TripAdvisor user
126244186.reviewBody: Very nice to see, next to it you will find cafe shops, restaurants and at night clubs!

122736986.name: exellent
122736986.author: a TripAdvisor user
122736986.reviewBody: just enjoy mi stay, is are very nice dow town, mui bonito

651133353.name: Centro historical
651133353.author: a TripAdvisor user
651133353.reviewBody: Just one of many cathedrals in the heart of the City in the historical area unbelievable archaeological buildings over three and four hundred years old the architecture is unbelievable

568966805.name: Don\'t walk up, take the cable car.
568966805.author: a TripAdvisor user
568966805.reviewBody: Walked from the nearby park, was a mistake, no shade & not very scenic. Great views from the top, the church is quaint, but small. Much better to take the cable car & walk back down or take the cable car both ways.

532175051.name: Spectacular view!
532175051.author: a TripAdvisor user
532175051.reviewBody: This is located on a hill.   it is very near town, you can go walking from the main plaza! there is a shopping store with real scorpions on everythig.  you can also have a beautiful view of Durango from here and ride the cableway. it is a fun ride and very inexpensive!

478047874.name: Great views
478047874.author: a TripAdvisor user
478047874.reviewBody: Nice way to spend an hour or so. You can see the entire city. At the bottom by the school down the steps is a nice little cofree shop restaurant. Stop in it is very charming. The area is very interesting looking. Some ferry nice homes and small shops and restaurants.

477546649.name: We took the teleferico to get here
477546649.author: a TripAdvisor user
477546649.reviewBody: The views are nice and we also came here at when it was sunset which made it amazing. There are some stores that sell snacks but no restaurants.

467465184.name: Nice visit
467465184.author: a TripAdvisor user
467465184.reviewBody: We visited this location as a part of a tour group. It was interesting to learn the history. This is the QST top before the cable car

459126255.name: Beautiful view of an old city
459126255.author: a TripAdvisor user
459126255.reviewBody:
The drive to the top of here is its self an interesting ride!,very narrow old steep streets to the top of the mountain with a multi level park,so be careful where you walk,the view is beautiful and you may miss a step while looking around.
Very nice view of Durango and the surrounding countryside with a very old church commanding this scene.it is cooler in Durango simply due to the higher altitude,and it may be cool and windy up here,so don't forget a jacket.
The tram was not operating that day and the store was closed,but that was ok.
We didn't go into the church but took a few pics of the ancient outside.
A nice place in a nice city.

411220483.name: It looks good on the picture but?
411220483.author: a TripAdvisor user
411220483.reviewBody: The picture looks beautiful but when you get there then you realize that it is nothing but a picture.  However, the Teleferico ride is nice and very inexpensive.  They should have a nice bar to enjoy a beer.  The people are very nice.

408260502.name: Teleferico
408260502.author: a TripAdvisor user
408260502.reviewBody: Definitely worth seeing! Especially at night you can see Durango\'s city lights! They tell you a little about the history of the region on the teleferico. We got some great night shots!

356171651.name: Commercial
356171651.author: a TripAdvisor user
356171651.reviewBody: How sad to see this lovely small, special church so commercialized.  But, it had been many years since l was in Durango.  Popular.  The city has spread.  A good way to orient oneself

345267310.name: Top of Cable Car scenic views
345267310.author: a TripAdvisor user
345267310.reviewBody: Rode the shot cable car (Teleferico) ride from downtown to the scenic outlook. The view is fine (not spectacular).,but there is nothing to do or see at the top other than look at the cityscape.

289344583.name: Excellent view of the city from here
289344583.author: a TripAdvisor user
289344583.reviewBody: This is the highest point in the city of Durango. From here you can see the entire city. I have been up there several times up and down the steps near the Universidad and up and down the street that leads there. A great place to relax enjoy the view and go inside the church and have a look.

262667348.name: Cityscape
262667348.author: a TripAdvisor user
262667348.reviewBody: We took the gondola to this side of Durango in the evening.  The city lights at night are very beautiful.  We were happily surprised to find live music when we arrived.  Don\'t miss this!

248122650.name: Great view of the city
248122650.author: a TripAdvisor user
248122650.reviewBody: This is more of less a cable car (teleferico in Spanish) that runs from the top of the city to an area closer to the center. The view of the city from the top is great and I definitely recommend bringing a camera or phone that can take panoramas. The cable car ride is pretty short, about 800 meters, with really nothing too amazing about it. There is a tour guide that goes with the car to the top who gives you info about the buildings you can see and local legends. If you go to the Museo Tunel de Minera first you can get a half-off ticket for the teleferico so its only 10 pesos for a roundtrip ride!

239034825.name: Incredible view of Durango
239034825.author: a TripAdvisor user
239034825.reviewBody: I went just for the cable car ride but the view at the end was just amazing, incredible.  Panoramic of all of Durango.  \nI left my backpack in the waiting room of the cable car and when I returned the backpack had been handed in and they were waiting to return it to me.\nIt was wonderful to have met such honest people.

213277784.name: A ride to the top of Durango.
213277784.author: a TripAdvisor user
213277784.reviewBody: I am glad we took this trip up.  I must say, when I first looked at the hill it went too, I was not impressed.  I had expected a hill much taller.  We went up anyway on the newly constructed tram.  I don\'t recall the cost of the tram ride but it was not so much as to bother my expensive alarm.\n    The ride was pleasant.  There was a dance demonstration on top by both children and adults in the traditional festive attire.  Parents and friends were enjoying it as we as us.  After the dance was over, we looked at the view of the city, beautiful.  We went to look at the church.  We were a the door looking in when a tall gentleman came and invited us in to take a look.  He had very little English skills but with my minimal spanish, we took a tour of the church.  Wow, so much history.  There is so much to learn from this town and there was so little time.  \n  You can not tour Durango in even two days.  I hope you you enjoy it  as much as I.

188496565.name: Great view!
188496565.author: a TripAdvisor user
188496565.reviewBody: Highly recommend this ride!  We took a taxi up the hill as we couldn\'t find where to load the tram to go both ways.  They need more signage or something.  Nice ride down & the view is great!

157267303.name: Nice Tram Ride
157267303.author: a TripAdvisor user
157267303.reviewBody: Rode the Tram  just as sun was setting. Had a spectacular view of city, once darkness settled in.\nNice ride back down, watching lights.

126244266.name: awesome view
126244266.author: a TripAdvisor user
126244266.reviewBody: very cool views of all the city of Durango. Try going during the day but instead of driving walk up the 2 sets of stairs, challenging but fun!

635832240.name: Extraordinario lugar
635832240.author: a TripAdvisor user
635832240.reviewBody:
Aunque la señalizacion para llegar al sitio desde la carretera Sombrerete-Durango no es muy clara, el lugar vale la pena. El divisadero es espectacular. Se puede descender hasta el cuerpo de agua por una escalera peraltada pero accesible. 
Y realmente vale la pena observar las raices de los arboles como han quedado expuestas al paso del rio. Un lugar excepcional sin duda para ir con la familia. Sugiero llevar repelente y botas o zapato cómodo para hacer el descenso.

address.streetAddress: Esta en Nombre de Dios, 53 km al sureste de la ciudad de Durango por la carretera 45

631491245.name: Hermoso
631491245.author: a TripAdvisor user
631491245.reviewBody: Lugra hermoso para disfrutar de la naturaleza. Su belleza es \u00fanica. Lo \u00fanico que deber\u00edan de mejorar es el acceso al mismo y poner algunos ba\u00f1os que hacen falta para los visitantes.

address.streetAddress: Esta en Nombre de Dios, 53 km al sureste de la ciudad de Durango por la carretera 45

603593051.name: En \u00e9poca de secas se ve bien, \u00bfqu\u00e9 ser\u00e1 en la de lluvias?
603593051.author: a TripAdvisor user
603593051.reviewBody: Un lugar impresionante. No fui cuando llevara agua, que me imagino que brinda la oportunidad de fotos muy buenas, pero en temporada de secas tienes oportunidad de bajar y tomar fotos entre los \u00e1rboles y rocas, y no te arrepentir\u00e1s.

address.streetAddress: Esta en Nombre de Dios, 53 km al sureste de la ciudad de Durango por la carretera 45

601832497.name: Lindo para fotos con poca accesibilidad
601832497.author: a TripAdvisor user
601832497.reviewBody: Queda como a media hora de la ciudad, y a no mas de 10 minutos de la carretera principal, es un camino bien cuidado y se\u00f1alado. Es excelente para ir en temporada de lluvias y poder apreciar las cascadas. Se puede descender por unas escaleras ubicadas un poco mas al fondo para disfrutar del paisaje (cascada, r\u00edo, ahuehuetes). Es importante tener mucho cuidado sobre todo con los ni\u00f1os, ya que la zona no cuenta con barandillas de seguridad ni en la parte superior ni en las escaleras. Tampoco hay locales establecidos o cercanos para obtener comida o bebidas.

address.streetAddress: Esta en Nombre de Dios, 53 km al sureste de la ciudad de Durango por la carretera 45

566115566.name: Excelente vista y tranquilidad
566115566.author: a TripAdvisor user
566115566.reviewBody: El lugar est\u00e1 lindo y se encuentra a unos 20 mins del centro de Durango, hay demasiada tranquilidad alrededor pienso que es de los lugares que debes conocer si visitas Durango sin embargo  considero que es un lugar para "visitar r\u00e1pido"   ya que no hay mucho que hacer ahi.

address.streetAddress: Esta en Nombre de Dios, 53 km al sureste de la ciudad de Durango por la carretera 45

542747060.name: Un lugar hermoso muy cerca de Durango.
542747060.author: a TripAdvisor user
542747060.reviewBody: Simplemente bell\u00edsimo lugar, aparece de la nada a unos cuantos cientos de metros de la carretera. Perfecto para llegar a pasar el d\u00eda de campo. Probablemente buena idea llegar primero por unas gorditas a Nombre de Dios, unas cervezas y a caerle al Saltito! Por supuesto, se debe tener presente que al ser un sitio totalmente natural, no cuenta con botes de basura por todos lados, as\u00ed que vayan preparados con bolsas para la basura, no queremos ensuciar un lugar tan bello y tranquilo, que te permite entrar en contacto con la naturaleza. Con mucho cuidado, si el nivel del agua lo permite, se puede caminar por la orilla hasta abajo de la cascada. Si eres valiente y habilidoso, incluso puedes trepar un poco. Si sabes pescar, en el lago seguro sacas algo comestible. Si vives en Durango y nunca has ido, o si eres de fuera y estar\u00e1s varios d\u00edas en Durango, recomiendo dedicarle al menos medio d\u00eda.

address.streetAddress: Esta en Nombre de Dios, 53 km al sureste de la ciudad de Durango por la carretera 45

539139380.name: Un espectaculo natural
539139380.author: a TripAdvisor user
539139380.reviewBody: Muy recomendada la visita sobre todo en temporada de lluvias, poder observar las cascadas es hermoso, tambi\u00e9n recomiendo dar un paseo hasta el ri\u00f3 (bajar) hay un ambiente muy m\u00edstico.

address.streetAddress: Esta en Nombre de Dios, 53 km al sureste de la ciudad de Durango por la carretera 45

500927751.name: bonito paisaje campestres un paseo
500927751.author: a TripAdvisor user
500927751.reviewBody: es un paseo que vale la pena hacerlo  es recomendable  hacerlo con autom\u00f3vilque caen una un toma como 45 minutos a una hora llegar por la carretera que a mexico o zacatecas son 3 cascadas que en esta \u00e9poca del a\u00f1o lleva abundante  agua  esta est\u00e1n rodeadas de roca volc\u00e1nica yn arboles  sabios con eno que contesta  hace muy bonito colorido es hermoso lugar para relajarse  inclusive hace un d\u00eda de campo

address.streetAddress: Esta en Nombre de Dios, 53 km al sureste de la ciudad de Durango por la carretera 45

484967463.name: PRECIOSA PANORAMICA DE LA CASCADA
484967463.author: a TripAdvisor user
484967463.reviewBody: cascada muy bonita y mas en tiempos de lluvia con mas contenido y mas fuerza en sus caidas de agua, lugar muy bonito y pintoresco, utulizado en varios escenas de peliculas famosas d ehollywood, altamente recomendable aunque un poco retirado de la ciudad, recomendado asitir en horarios de no tanto calor

address.streetAddress: Esta en Nombre de Dios, 53 km al sureste de la ciudad de Durango por la carretera 45

480983513.name: Hermoso y majestuoso... pero...
480983513.author: a TripAdvisor user
480983513.reviewBody: Paisaje \u00fanico a muchos kil\u00f3metros a la redonda del norte de M\u00e9xico. No en vano ha sido locaci\u00f3n para sin fin de pel\u00edculas nacionales como internacionales... Clark Gable, John Wayne, Charlton Heston, Kirk Douglas, Jack Nicholson, Michel Douglas, Lee Van Cleef, Clint Eastwood, Bob Dylan, Ringo Starr, etc... Solo que la basura y el que no cuente con servicios m\u00ednimos para los visitantes acorta la visita y en algunos casos (la basura) abochorna...

address.streetAddress: Esta en Nombre de Dios, 53 km al sureste de la ciudad de Durango por la carretera 45

469402240.name: Buenas fotos
469402240.author: a TripAdvisor user
469402240.reviewBody: La verdad el lugar est\u00e1 muy bonito solo que est\u00e1 s\u00faper descuidado, muy sucio y no tiene lugar para sentarse, el gobierno deber\u00eda de meterle mano para hacerlo m\u00e1s atractivo pero se pueden tomar buenas fotograf\u00edas

address.streetAddress: Esta en Nombre de Dios, 53 km al sureste de la ciudad de Durango por la carretera 45

458771249.name: Se puede aprovechar y cuidar m\u00e1s
458771249.author: a TripAdvisor user
458771249.reviewBody: Un paraje natural con cascadas, en tiempo de lluvia la cascada es espectacular. Es necesario bajar y se encuentran arboles gigantes y un paisaje fuera de este mundo.\nHace falta mayor atenci\u00f3n para que no se deteriore m\u00e1s y para que los visitantes no dejen basura.

address.streetAddress: Esta en Nombre de Dios, 53 km al sureste de la ciudad de Durango por la carretera 45

457245020.name: Les falta
457245020.author: a TripAdvisor user
457245020.reviewBody: Les falta lugares donde sentarse, dep\u00f3sitos de basura no los hay (si es que hay, hay pocos), algun tipo de ba\u00f1o, porque no los hay (solo hacer en el "arbolito", pero es incomodo para las mujeres)

address.streetAddress: Esta en Nombre de Dios, 53 km al sureste de la ciudad de Durango por la carretera 45

452551923.name: Bellas cascadas y paraje solitario
452551923.author: a TripAdvisor user
452551923.reviewBody: Estas cascadas se encuentran ubicadas a aproximadamente 30 0 40 minutos en autom\u00f3vil partiendo desde la ciudad de Durango, Durango. Oficialmente no hay una entrada al lugar, por lo que no se cobra para ingresar, es decir, es gratuito. Se mantiene hasta la fecha como un sitio muy natural y poco visitado por los turistas, pues quienes m\u00e1s acuden ah\u00ed son los lugare\u00f1os. Excelente lugar para tomar algunas fotograf\u00edas o hacer un d\u00eda de campo.

address.streetAddress: Esta en Nombre de Dios, 53 km al sureste de la ciudad de Durango por la carretera 45

581080128.name: Poncho Villa
581080128.author: a TripAdvisor user
581080128.reviewBody: He was not a very nice man, he was a philanderer, he was an egomaniac.  However, he got the revolution started.\n

address.streetAddress: Av. 5 de febrero Zaragoza y Bruno Martinez

576996211.name: Not for those not well-versed in Spanish or Pancho Villa\'s History
576996211.author: a TripAdvisor user
576996211.reviewBody: The museum was beautiful and the presentations were very well done.  However, another reviewer said there were English translations.  There were not.  We enjoyed the experience and tried to garner as much information as we could but this attraction is really only for Spanish speakers.  I agree that my Spanish should be better but in this place, it would have to be very good.  It was still a pleasant way to pass a morning.

address.streetAddress: Av. 5 de febrero Zaragoza y Bruno Martinez

568966258.name: Beautiful Museum with lots of information
568966258.author: a TripAdvisor user
568966258.reviewBody: Really well done, with lots of interactive displays. Lots of good historic information  and displays, very impressive.  The building itself is stunning as well. Definitely worth a visit.

address.streetAddress: Av. 5 de febrero Zaragoza y Bruno Martinez

564425972.name: great   statues   all  over  this  area
564425972.author: a TripAdvisor user
564425972.reviewBody: walked   all  over  this  area  of  town  at   nite  was   amazing  with  everything  all  lit  up   then  i  went  back    the  next  day  and  did  it  again\n

address.streetAddress: Av. 5 de febrero Zaragoza y Bruno Martinez

554753062.name: Exciting history in a gorgeous setting
554753062.author: a TripAdvisor user
554753062.reviewBody: The history of Pancho Villa is displayed with respect and accuracy, easy to understand and includes an English translation.  The museum itself is in a beautiful building that will make you feel like you are in a old Spanish city.

address.streetAddress: Av. 5 de febrero Zaragoza y Bruno Martinez

553438012.name: Essential
553438012.author: a TripAdvisor user
553438012.reviewBody: If you want to learn about Mexican history and see wonderful murals and interesting stuff, do not miss this. Entrance fee was so little that I cannot recall. $1 or something.

address.streetAddress: Av. 5 de febrero Zaragoza y Bruno Martinez

541034901.name: Worthwhile stop if doing a tour of Durango. Take an hour. Educational.
541034901.author: a TripAdvisor user
541034901.reviewBody: I was not as familiar with some of the history and exploits of Pancho Villa. A scourge to the Mexican Government and like Robin Hood to the local people. Good exhibits and if you get an english speaking guide even better. Some interesting stories and history involving Pancho and his compadres. May have actually succeeded had he not been sold dud rifles from an American "Businessman". I also learned that Gringo actually stems from the unauthorized incursion by American soldiers into Mexico at this time and the colour of their uniforms. Green.. Gringo is "Green go" as the locals encouraged the Americans to depart and let them resolve their revolution without assistance or intervention.

address.streetAddress: Av. 5 de febrero Zaragoza y Bruno Martinez

512471735.name: Interesting and educational!
512471735.author: a TripAdvisor user
512471735.reviewBody: We have always been interested in the Mexican folk hero, Pancho Villa, so visiting this museum dedicated to him was our chance to learn more about his part in Mexican history. We were lucky enough to get an English speaking guide, which made our visit so worthwhile! Through our guide we were able to really understand who Pancho Villa was and what made him so revered to his people (at least through this  museum\'s viewpoint). We would not have had such a great understanding otherwise as most of the displays are in Spanish, which we are not fluent enough in to really get. We were able to learn fascinating little known details and idiosyncrasies about Pancho Villa. Check out Pancho\'s beautiful signature as well as many artifacts donated by his family. \nThe historic building housing the museum is just beautiful and worth admission in itself. There are wonderful murals and some displays on current government as well to check out. Other museums in Durango pale in comparison to this one. It is just so well done in all aspects....environment, flow, displays, curated objects, graphics, lighting, ect. This is a good place to visit for a couple of hours and you will come away with some understanding of what a huge part Pancho Villa made in Mexico\'s history.

address.streetAddress: Av. 5 de febrero Zaragoza y Bruno Martinez

493845431.name: Great local history
493845431.author: a TripAdvisor user
493845431.reviewBody: We were fortunate enough to have an English speaking guide. The history of Durango and Mexico in general was fascinating and the architecture was simply stunning. Would definitely return.

address.streetAddress: Av. 5 de febrero Zaragoza y Bruno Martinez

492883944.name: well-done & very interesting
492883944.author: a TripAdvisor user
492883944.reviewBody: The exhibits are extensive, very well done & have lots of historical information put in context. Everything, with a few minor exceptions, was in Spanish. I think there are English-speaking guides available for those who don\'t read Spanish. Pancho Villa was a very important, historical person with ties to early 20th C events in Mexico & the US. Recommend a visit to this museum..

address.streetAddress: Av. 5 de febrero Zaragoza y Bruno Martinez

478045825.name: Do not miss Villas story
478045825.author: a TripAdvisor user
478045825.reviewBody: Located in a beautiful old home is one of the best museums I have seen. Make sure you take a guide, they have great insight and stories that on our own we wouldn\'t know.  Amazing how much of Mexican history that although we live on the same continent we although Canadians do\'the know.

address.streetAddress: Av. 5 de febrero Zaragoza y Bruno Martinez

470271959.name: Lots of good information about Poncho Villa
470271959.author: a TripAdvisor user
470271959.reviewBody: We had a tour guide who spoke very good English.  Were it not for him it would\'ve been boring as all the placards are in Spanish.  (We tipped him 20 pesos because I think he works for tips.)  \n\nNot the most exciting or informative museum we\'ve been to, but it was worthwhile.

address.streetAddress: Av. 5 de febrero Zaragoza y Bruno Martinez

468768073.name: Pleasantly surprised
468768073.author: a TripAdvisor user
468768073.reviewBody: Beautiful historic building and 1st world museum... found it very intereting...this is a must in Durango

address.streetAddress: Av. 5 de febrero Zaragoza y Bruno Martinez

467465439.name: Tour group
467465439.author: a TripAdvisor user
467465439.reviewBody: We visited this as a part of a city tour. It was really nice and layer out. We had Robert as our tour guide and his English was amazing. Lots of neat stuff exhibits along with a computer that puts ur face onto historical people.  A must see.

address.streetAddress: Av. 5 de febrero Zaragoza y Bruno Martinez

460493731.name: Proud history!
460493731.author: a TripAdvisor user
460493731.reviewBody:
We stopped by a beautiful old building that was a private residence for a rich owner.
We were given an informative tour in English which really helped our weak Spanish.
Interactive displays and signs are in Spanish,but this museum is so well done it's quite easy to follow along.
Very nicely done and the Mexican pride in their history is very evident,I recommend this place for a good afternoon tour.

address.streetAddress: Av. 5 de febrero Zaragoza y Bruno Martinez

459368538.name: Not enough time to enjoy
459368538.author: a TripAdvisor user
459368538.reviewBody: We were on a bus tour out of Mazatan and very much enjoyed our visit to the museum...our only criticism is that we didn\'t have enough time....and although our guide at the museum was well informed he seemed to lack any passion Pancho Villa was a very significant individual in terms of Mexican history ..in fact he led what was quite an extraordinary life...with parallels to Robin Hood....I hope you get to spend more time than we did.

address.streetAddress: Av. 5 de febrero Zaragoza y Bruno Martinez

457429188.name: Very Interesting Museum
457429188.author: a TripAdvisor user
457429188.reviewBody: Included in our day tour to Durango was a visit to the Pancho Villa Museum.  It contains a lot of historical information on the Mexican Revolution and the person known as Pancho Villa.  All of the written descriptions are only in Spanish, so if you only speak English it is imperative to have one of the local museum guides.  Our guide spoke English quite well, but his quiet demeanor along with his accent made him a little difficult to hear or understand.  Nevertheless, he did a good job explaining what we were seeing.  There are lots of interesting historical pictures, which has encouraged me to find out more about this interesting character and the Mexican Revolution.

address.streetAddress: Av. 5 de febrero Zaragoza y Bruno Martinez

452416220.name: All in Spanish
452416220.author: a TripAdvisor user
452416220.reviewBody: This museum is very good, but it is all in Spanish, so going to this without a guide or personal knowledge of Spanish can be limiting.  The price was 10 pesos, which equated to 50 cents USD when we were there.  \n\nThe displays are very well done and it is in one of the historic old houses of Durango.  The museum itself is hard to find if you are looking for any information at the local tourist stops and info kiosks that are around the town.

address.streetAddress: Av. 5 de febrero Zaragoza y Bruno Martinez

445111678.name: Very informative
445111678.author: a TripAdvisor user
445111678.reviewBody: This was an excellent museum and did a great job of explaining the Pancho Villa from a Mexican perspective (where he is seen as a folk hero).  We were rushed through the museum as our tour was running late -- on my own, I would have suggested spending 2-3 hours to truly take in the museum.

address.streetAddress: Av. 5 de febrero Zaragoza y Bruno Martinez

435160808.name: So informative
435160808.author: a TripAdvisor user
435160808.reviewBody: Excellent knowledgeable local guide gave us very informative and interesting tour. His English was excellent, knew a lot, answered all questions.

address.streetAddress: Av. 5 de febrero Zaragoza y Bruno Martinez

429363871.name: Majestic, worth admiring it
429363871.author: a TripAdvisor user
429363871.reviewBody: The place exhudes history, its exhibits are first class, the murals are overwhelming, a great experience

address.streetAddress: Av. 5 de febrero Zaragoza y Bruno Martinez

379234153.name: Great Museum!
379234153.author: a TripAdvisor user
379234153.reviewBody: This is a wonderful museum with beautiful murals and great exhibits showcasing the life and importance of Pancho Villa to Mexico. This is a must see when in Durango.  At the end of our tour there was an area where you can dress up in "revolutionary wear" and pose with Pancho Villa.

address.streetAddress: Av. 5 de febrero Zaragoza y Bruno Martinez

375168758.name: Good History Lesson On Mexico
375168758.author: a TripAdvisor user
375168758.reviewBody: I learned a lot about the internal struggles and civil wars in Mexico and Pancho Villa. The displays and artifacts were well displayed with written descriptions. For those that don\'t know, you will understand where the term "gringo" came from. I think it should be on your list of places to see in Durango.

address.streetAddress: Av. 5 de febrero Zaragoza y Bruno Martinez

351427570.name: Wonderful and entertaining for an hour or two
351427570.author: a TripAdvisor user
351427570.reviewBody: The museum staff is great, entertaining and commuted to sharing more than most could ever hope to know about their hero, his life and times. It\'s a modern presentation in the old Governor\'s Palace, which itself is a colonial gem. Worth a visit, good for kids.

address.streetAddress: Av. 5 de febrero Zaragoza y Bruno Martinez

345267726.name: Interesting museum showing many little known aspects of the life and times of Francisco Villa
345267726.author: a TripAdvisor user
345267726.reviewBody: Well late out displays and artifacts lead you through a chronology of Francisco Villa\'s life and times.

address.streetAddress: Av. 5 de febrero Zaragoza y Bruno Martinez

341087999.name: Interesting
341087999.author: a TripAdvisor user
341087999.reviewBody: Did this tour with another couple, in English.  Lots of information about Mexican history and Pancho Villa.  I liked it.

address.streetAddress: Av. 5 de febrero Zaragoza y Bruno Martinez

341083540.name: Fabulous Museum!
341083540.author: a TripAdvisor user
341083540.reviewBody:
